Output:
The metric chosen to evaluate the predictive power of the models in the related study was the coefficient of determination (R^2). This metric measures the proportion of the variance in the dependent variable (i.e., the soil property being predicted) that can be explained by the independent variables (i.e., the pXRF data and soil texture). 

The R^2 values obtained in this study ranged from 0.14 to 0.71, depending on the soil property being predicted. These values indicate the percentage of variability in the soil properties that can be accounted for by the models. 

However, it is important to note that the R^2 values alone do not provide a complete assessment of the predictive power of the models. Other metrics, such as root mean square error (RMSE), should also be considered to evaluate the accuracy and precision of the predictions. Additionally, further studies are needed to determine the generalizability of the models to other soil properties beyond the ones investigated in this study.
